segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, and I’m terrified he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is tipping, and he’s reaching so high—it’s like he’s begging for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman drying dishes is the most oblivious person I’ve ever seen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and she’s just standing there, drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything around her is a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the water is making the floor dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone is going to stop him before he hurts himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, not even noticing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is the most chaotic scene I’ve ever seen in a kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR
